definition: to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: He turned to the audience with an embarrassed sigh.
sentences.chinese: 他轉向聽衆併發出了窘迫的嘆息聲。

sentences.english: He was hazed by Tom's satire.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的譏諷令他十分窘迫。

sentences.english: Without embarrassment, I covered his coffin with the largest, reddest roses I could find.
sentences.chinese: 沒有窘迫，我用很多鮮豔的紅玫瑰鋪在棺材上。

sentences.english: He was in a state of mingled embarrassment and defiance.
sentences.chinese: 他交織着一種又窘迫又想反抗的心情。

sentences.english: When the telephone rings, some new OLs or OGs ( Office Ladies or gentlemen) will get upset.
sentences.chinese: 當電話鈴響時，一些辦公室白領們往往會很窘迫。

sentences.english: Ms. Lateef says conditions like these keep small farmers in poverty.
sentences.chinese: 拉蒂夫女士說，這樣的環境造成小農場主生活窘迫。

sentences.english: People who have very little and who see themselves as victim.
sentences.chinese: 生活窘迫的人覺得自己是受害者。

sentences.english: Social phobia is a strong fear of being judged by others and of being embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 社交恐懼是一種對他人評價和窘迫場景的強烈恐懼。

sentences.english: Conclusion Endouterine asphyxia is one of the main factors of asphyxia neonatorum.
sentences.chinese: 結論宮內窘迫是造成新生兒窒息的主要原因之一。

sentences.english: It was locked, and the man waited patiently as my embarrassed spouse struggled to remember the bination .
sentences.chinese: 他耐心的等着我那窘迫的丈夫想法回想起暗鎖的密碼。

sentences.english: The white has no and seems to look her hard-pressed, no longer force to want answer to her.
sentences.chinese: 白無及似乎看出了她的窘迫，不再向她逼要答案。

sentences.english: "You said the first of the week, " said Carrie, greatly abashed.
sentences.chinese: “你是說星期一來的，”嘉莉很窘迫地說。

sentences.english: Forgetting the introductory remarks really mortified me.
sentences.chinese: 忘記了開場白真使我窘迫。

sentences.english: She has been living from selling sex due to poverty.
sentences.chinese: 生活窘迫，她一直以賣春爲生。

sentences.english: Some are always crowded and must push and struggle for room, always feeling disconcerted.
sentences.chinese: 有些人很窘迫，總是處於推搡和擁擠之中。

sentences.english: The rate at which a person can mature is directly proportional to the embarrassment he can tolerate.
sentences.chinese: 一個人成熟的速度是跟他所能忍受的窘迫鹹正比的。

definition: hard pressed for money/in financial straits
in a difficult situation/to cut a sorry figure/scoundrel! (derog.)
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
